1.name: Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages
1.description: The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.

2.name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
2.description: A French professor and his daughter accompany Captain Nemo on an adventure aboard a submarine.

3.name: Sherlock Holmes
3.description: When a couple of swindlers hold young Alice Faulkner against her will in order to discover the whereabouts of letters which could spell scandal for the royal family, Sherlock Holmes is on the case.

5.name: Where Are My Children?
5.description: A District Attorney's outspoken stand on abortion gets him in trouble with the local community.

6.name: Snow White
6.description: Snow White is a motherless princess, who arouses the jealousy and hatred of Mary Jane, her mother's former lady-in-waiting, who is the ugliest woman in the kingdom, but aspires to the ...                See full summary »

7.name: Judex
7.description: A twelve part serial following the adventures of the masked vigilante Judex as he fights against criminals led by the corrupt banker Favrauxom.

8.name: A Daughter of the Gods
8.description: A sultan agrees to help an wicked witch destroy a mysterious young lady, if the witch will bring his young son back from the dead with magic.

9.name: Shoes
9.description: A young working girl must suport her family on only five dollars a week. The strain of trying to feed, house and clothe her mother, her father and three brothers finally gets to be too much...                See full summary »

10.name: Joan the Woman
10.description: A WWI English officer is inspired the night before a dangerous mission by a vision of Joan of Arc, whose story he relives.

11.name: The Fall of a Nation
11.description: Three acts and a prologue. Act 1: A nation falls. Act 2: The heel of the conqueror. Act 3: The uprising two years later.

12.name: Homunculus, 1. Teil
12.description: Part of the artificial-creature series encompassing Der Golem (1914 and 1920), Alraune (1918, 1928, 1930) and Metropolis (1926), 'Homunculus' was the most popular serial in Germany during ...                See full summary »

13.name: Hell's Hinges
13.description: In the wayward western town known as Hell's Hinges, a local tough guy is reformed by the faith of a good woman.

14.name: Lovely Mary
14.description: Mary Lane and her cousin Claiborne want to sell some land left to them by their family. Real-estate agent Roland Manning falls in love with her, and prepares a deal that will make money for...                See full summary »

15.name: The Half-Breed
15.description: An outcast named Lo Dorman encounters a young woman lost in the woods. He defends her from danger in the forest and from Sheriff Dunn.

17.name: The Mysteries of Myra
17.description: Myra Maynard, is plagued by a wide variety of metaphysical assaults by the corrupt Black Order, a secret organization which uses magic, curses and any supernatural means possible to achieve its ends.

18.name: Sweet Kitty Bellairs
18.description: Kitty Bellairs is a flirtatious young girl on a holiday trip to Bath, in 18 Century England. Her sister becomes involved in a scandal, from which Kitty rescues her from, all the while ...                See full summary »

19.name: Peggy
19.description: Peggy, a rambunctious young American girl, goes to Scotland to visit her uncle. Her American ways both shock and eventually delight the people of the old village - especially the handsome ...                See full summary »

20.name: The End of the World
20.description: A comet, passing by Earth, causes rioting, social unrest, and major disasters that destroy the world.

21.name: The Foundling
21.description: Rich artist David King sends his infant daughter Molly to an orphanage, then years later regrets it and tries to find her. She's sent to slave at a boarding house,and the mistress of the orphanage passes her niece off as Molly.

23.name: Pikovaya dama
23.description: While hosting a game of cards one night, Narumov tells his friends a story about his grandmother, a Countess. As a young woman, she had once incurred an enormous gambling debt, which she ...                See full summary »

24.name: Romeo and Juliet
24.description: Shakespeare's classic tale of ill-fated lovers whose deaths bring peace to their warring families.

25.name: The Americano
25.description: Doug is an American mining engineer. Pres. Valdez of Paragonia (Aitken) wants him to reopen the country's mines. Doug is not interested ... until he sees the President's beautiful daughter,...                See full summary »

27.name: Snow White
27.description: "Mirror, mirror on the wall who's the fairest of them all?" The Wicked Queen knows that the looking glass will always answer, "you are." But one day, the magic mirror has something new to ...                See full summary »

28.name: Homunculus
28.description: A group of scientists, led by a Professor Ortmann, produce a living human child using scientific processes - a "homunculus." This creature is human in every way, except that he cannot experience love.

29.name: The Dumb Girl of Portici
29.description: Fenella, a poor Italian girl, falls in love with a Spanish nobleman, but their affair triggers a revolution and national catastrophe.

30.name: The Cossack Whip
30.description: Feodor Turov, chief of the Russian Czar's secret police, orders his Cossacks to attack a village he believes to be infested with rebels. The Cossacks attack the village and massacre almost ...                See full summary »

31.name: Friday the 13th
31.description: When a judge is financially ruined by Peter Brownley, a Wall Street millionaire, his daughter seeks revenge by getting a job in the tycoon's office. She manages to discover information that...                See full summary »

32.name: Less Than the Dust
32.description: Young Hindu woman Radha, becomes best friends with Captain Raymond Townsend during his service in India, but he soon goes back to England to tend to the estate of an uncle who has just died...                See full summary »

34.name: The Plow Girl
34.description: A story that begins on the South African veldt and goes to the drawing rooms of fashionable London Society.

35.name: The Good Bad Man
35.description: An outlaw calling himself Passin' Through halts his "evil" ways long enough to help out some children in difficulty.

36.name: Vingarne
36.description: An adaptation of Herman Bang's 1902 novel "Mikaël." A sculptor befriends a young painter who becomes his model. Their friendship is thrown into turmoil when they both fall in love with the same woman.

37.name: Blind Justice
37.description: A criminal escapes from prison, however a betrayal leads to his second arrest.

38.name: Posle smerti
38.description: Andrei lives a secluded life with his aunt, studying and thinking about his now-deceased mother. His friend Tsenin is concerned, and tries to get Andrei to accompany him to social events. ...                See full summary »

39.name: Davy Crockett
39.description: The story of the famous Tennessee frontiersman, soldier, scout, and Congressman who fought and died at the Alamo.

40.name: Hoodoo Ann
40.description: A little orphan girl believes that her life is falling apart. It seems that everything that could possibly go wrong does go wrong. However, certain things happen that begin to make her ...                See full summary »

41.name: Diane of the Follies
41.description: A strait-laced amateur sociologist, Phillips Christy, from a wealthy family subscribes to the theory that people are shaped by their environment. When he falls in love with Diane, a ...                See full summary »

42.name: The Warrior
42.description: A soldier of near-superhuman strength fights battles in the First World War and wages a private war to rescue a young woman from the castle where she is imprisoned.

44.name: Macbeth
44.description: Shakespeare's tragedy of the Scots nobleman whose ambition leads him to betrayal, murder, and damnation.

45.name: The Dream Girl
45.description: The father of San Francisco waif Meg runs an illegal liquor club and supports "English" Hal in scheme to blackmail a wealthy girl. Meg is put on probation to Benjamin Merton, father of the ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Social Pirates
46.description: Two women finally tire of being taken advantage of by men, and vow that they will stop these cads from preying on helpless young girls.

47.name: Il fuoco (la favilla - la vampa - la cenere)
47.description: Mario, an unknown painter, remains struck and obsessed with meeting a famous poet, already married, who will be able to charm him, so that he will no longer have the talent created to be able to paint.

49.name: American Aristocracy
49.description: A young man fights to overcome a piratical arms smuggler and to win the heart of a rich man's daughter.

50.name: Mice and Men
50.description: Mark Embury sets out to create the perfect wife by adopting Peggy. His work is a success until the girl falls in love with another man. Ultimately, he must give her up and become satisfied ...                See full summary »
